function.name: createWorkOrder
function.description: Creates a new maintenance work order in DoorLoop. Use this tool after collecting all required information from the tenant (unit number, name, phone, issue description). This tool should be used for NON-EMERGENCY maintenance requests.

tenantName.description: Full name of the tenant reporting the issue

tenantPhone.description: Best phone number to reach the tenant

issueDescription.description: Detailed description of the maintenance issue, including location, what's happening, and severity

urgency.description: Urgency level: 'urgent' (2-hour response, High priority), 'standard' (24-hour response, Medium priority), 'low' (3-5 days, Low priority)

whenStarted.description: When the tenant first noticed the issue (optional)

bodyTemplate.subject: {{category}} - {{unitNumber}}: {{issueDescription}}

function.name: escalateToEmergency
function.description: Escalates a maintenance request to emergency status and creates a high-priority task in DoorLoop. Use this ONLY for true emergencies: HVAC failure in extreme temperatures, major water leaks/flooding, complete power outage, gas leaks, or security issues.

tenantPhone.description: Best phone number to reach the tenant

issueDescription.description: Detailed description of the emergency, including safety concerns

safetyNotes.description: Any safety concerns: children, elderly, pets, extent of issue, weather conditions

bodyTemplate.subject: üö® EMERGENCY - {{category}} - {{unitNumber}}

function.name: dispatchEmergencyVendor
function.description: Creates a high-priority emergency task in DoorLoop. Use this tool ONLY in emergency mode after providing safety guidance to the tenant. Note: Vendor assignment will be handled manually by property manager.

workOrderId.description: The work order/task ID from DoorLoop (if already created)

arrivalTimeEstimate.description: Estimated arrival time: '30min' (vendor nearby), '1hour' (standard), '2hours' (vendor farther away)

safetyNotes.description: Important details for vendor: family situation, extent of issue, weather conditions, tenant location if evacuated

tenantPhone.description: Tenant's phone number for vendor callback

function.name: provideStatus
function.description: Retrieves the current status of a task/work order from DoorLoop. Use this when tenant asks for an update, or if more than 20 minutes have passed since dispatch without vendor callback.

taskId.description: The DoorLoop task ID to check status on

function.name: confirmCompletion
function.description: Marks a task/work order as completed in DoorLoop and records tenant feedback. Use this in followup mode when tenant confirms the issue is resolved and they're satisfied. This will update the task status to 'Completed'.

taskId.description: The DoorLoop task ID to close

tenantConfirmed.description: Whether tenant confirmed completion (should always be true when calling this)

issueResolved.description: Whether the issue is fully resolved

feedbackNotes.description: Summary of tenant's feedback in 1-2 sentences. Include comments about technician professionalism, timeliness, work quality, and any concerns.

inspectionRequired.description: Whether a manager inspection is needed. True for major repairs (>$500), tenant concerns, or quality issues.

function.name: reopenWorkOrder
function.description: Reopens a task/work order in DoorLoop that was marked complete but the issue is NOT actually resolved. Use this in followup mode when tenant reports the problem still exists or wasn't fixed properly. This will update the task status and add notes about the issue.

taskId.description: The DoorLoop task ID to reopen

reason.description: Detailed reason for reopening, including what's still wrong and any new symptoms

urgency.description: Urgency level for the rework: 'emergency' (same as original emergency), 'urgent' (2-hour response), 'standard' (24 hours)

tenantAvailability.description: When the tenant is available for the vendor to return

function.name: scheduleInspection
function.description: Creates a manager inspection task in DoorLoop. Use this in followup mode for major repairs (>$500), when tenant has concerns about work quality, or when final approval is needed before closing the work order.

relatedTaskId.description: The original work order/task ID that requires inspection

inspectionType.description: Type of inspection: 'quality_check' (major repair), 'tenant_concern' (tenant reported issues), 'final_approval' (>$500 repairs), 'damage_assessment' (additional work needed)

reason.description: Reason for the inspection (e.g., 'Major HVAC repair over $500', 'Tenant reports new leak after repair')

tenantAvailability.description: When tenant is available for the 10-minute inspection

bodyTemplate.subject: Manager Inspection Required - Unit {{unitNumber}} - {{inspectionType}}
